intro: Hiraea demerarensis, commonly known as the Demerara hiraea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil and Venezuela. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Hiraea demerarensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
